intro: Ammodaucus maroccanus, commonly known as the Moroccan fennel, is a herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant features feathery, finely divided leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in umbels. It is well adapted to dry climates and can thrive in poor soils. Its essential oils are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary spice.
